standards.header: Qualified physician is responsible for managing the oncology and radiotherapy services.

details.header: The individual(s) responsible for the oncology and radiotherapy services is qualified by education, training, and experience in the fields of oncology/radiation oncology.

standards.header: The hospital ensures full compliance with the relevant regulations on radiation.

details.header: The hospital has a valid license for the provision of radiotherapy services from relevant authorities (King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology).

standards.header: Oncology and radiotherapy services are provided by qualified staff.

details.header: Oncology and radiotherapy services are adequately staffed as follows:
details: Oncologists/Radiation oncologists.
Medical physicists.
Radiation therapists.
Mould room technicians.
Radiation safety officer and supervisor.
Quality officer.

details.header: Staff are trained and qualified in their fields.
Clinical staff maintain registration with the Saudi Commission for Health Specialties.

standards.header: Qualified nurse manager(s) supervises nursing practices in the oncology and radiotherapy services.

details.header: The nurse manager is a registered nurse qualified by education, training, and experience in the field of oncology/radiotherapy.
The nurse manager develops and collaborates with other disciplines for developing all relevant policies and procedures including, but are not limited to:
details: Chemotherapy administration, side effects, and safety precautions.
Radiation therapy administration, side effects, and safety precautions.
Targetedtherapy, immunotherapy and contrast media administration and education.
Spill management.
Special radiation techniques (brachytherapy, stereotactic radiotherapy, unsealed sources, other techniques), including preparation and delivery guidelines.
Extravasations and anaphylaxis management guidelines.
Radioactive iodine management.
Dying and end of life care management.
Bone marrow and stem cell transplant management.
Management of neutropenia and other related complications of chemo/radiation therapy.

standards.header: Oncology and radiotherapy services are guided and overseen by a multidisciplinary committee.

details.header: There is a multidisciplinary committee to guide and oversee oncology and radiotherapy services.
The committee meets at least four times a year. The record of the minutes of meetings is maintained.
The committee assists in developing and reviewing policies, procedures, safety plan, guidelines and protocols for the provision of a safe patient care.
The committee ensures implementation of policies and procedures.

standards.header: Oncology and radiotherapy services include a palliative care unit/service.

details.header: The unit has policies and procedures, guidelines and protocols for the palliative care including pain management and management of illness/treatment-related symptoms.
Staff are well trained on palliative care practices.

standards.header: There is a safety plan to ensure the safety of oncology and radiotherapy services.

details.header: There is a written safety plan that includes:
details: Periodic inspection, maintenance and calibration of the linear accelerator andother radiation equipment.
Guidelines on how to inspect and monitor the medical equipment.
Management of nuclear material used for therapeutic and diagnostic purposes, especially in regard to its handling, storing, and transportation.

details.header: The safety plan is implemented and audited for effectiveness.

standards.header: Oncology and radiotherapy services implement admission and discharge criteria.

details.header: There are admission and discharge criteria for patients receiving oncology and radiotherapy services.
The criteria are collaboratively developed by physicians and nursing staff.

standards.header: The nurse manager ensures the competency of the nursing staff.

details.header: The nursing staff receive training and education that are necessary for the provision of effective and safe care including, but are not limited to:
details: Central and peripheral venous access device.
Care of tracheostomies.
Chest tube management.
Advanced medication administration, including targeted therapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and hormonal therapy.
Line management including extravasations. Radiation side effects management.
Assisting and preparing for lumber puncture.
Assisting in intrathecal administration of chemotherapy.
Infection control, including hazardous material and blood spill.
lood transfusion.
Use of defibrillator.

details.header: Nursing staff competencies are assessed and are documented.

standards.header: Appropriate documentation is maintained for quality control activities of the oncology and radiotherapy services.

details.header: Quality records are maintained, which include:
details: Periodic inspection, maintenance and calibration of the linear accelerator and other radiation equipment.
Records of the isotopes used in treatment that include its energy, calibration, and disposal.
Records of the radiation dosimetry and staff radiation exposure for the past twelve months.
